instruction: Explain how the given event changed the course of history.
input: The invention of the printing press.
output: The invention of the printing press in the 15th century revolutionized the spread of information and ideas. By enabling people to quickly and easily replicate text and images, books, pamphlets and newspapers could be printed in much larger numbers than ever before. This made education more accessible and increased the spread of knowledge throughout Europe, eventually leading to the spread of new ideas that fueled the Renaissance and sparked social and political revolutions.
